alert.note: Alert for Craig; Delaware; Mayes; Ottawa (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 13 at 8:49PM CDT until August 14 at 5:15AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Arkansas and northeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, in northwest Arkansas, Benton and Carroll. In northeast Oklahoma, Craig, Delaware, Mayes and Ottawa. * WHEN...Until 7 AM CDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Thunderstorms are expected to develop tonight along and ahead of a frontal boundary moving through the area and impacting areas that saw some heavy rain this morning. High precipitable water values will lead to rain rates of 2-3 inches per hour possible in the heaviest thunderstorms. Additionally, training of storms will be possible along the boundary overnight tonight. This will create increasing potential for flash flooding conditions within the watch area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
